name: Acetic acid
Relationship: Compare: Am-acet. (Profuse saccharine urine, patient is bathed in sweat.) Benzoin oderiferum - Spice-wood (night sweats.) Ars.; China; Digitalis; Liatris. General anasarca in heart and kidney disease, dropsy, and chronic diarrhoea.)Acetic acid is antidotal to all anaesthetic vapors. Counteracts sausage poisoning.

Head: Temporal vessels distended
Blood rushes to head with delirium
Nervous headache, from abuse of narcotics
Respiratory: Hoarse, hissing respiration; DIFFICULT BREATHING; COUGH WHEN INHALING
Irritation of trachea and bronchial tubes
Stomach: Vomits after every kind of food
Burning pain as of an ulcer
VIOLENT BURNING PAIN IN STOMACH AND CHEST, FOLLOWED BY COLDNESS OF SKIN AND COLD SWEAT ON FOREHEAD
Stomach feels as if she had taken a lot of vinegar
Burning water brash and profuse salivation
Urine: Diabetes, with great thirst and debility
Back: Pain in back, RELIEVED ONLY BY LYING ON ABDOMEN
Female: Breasts painfully enlarged, distended with milk
Skin: Burning, dry, hot skin, or bathed in profuse sweat
Useful after stings, bites, etc. Varicose swellings
Diminished sensibility of the surface of body
Abdomen: Frequent watery stools, worse in morning
Feels as if abdomen was sinking in

details: This drug produces a condition of profound anemia, with some dropsical symptoms, great debility, frequent fainting, dyspnea, weak heart, vomiting, profuse urination and sweat. Hemorrhage from any part. Especially indicated in pale, lean persons, with lax, flabby muscles. WASTING AND DEBILITY. Acetic acid has the power to LIQUEFY ALBUMINOUS AND FIBRINOUS DEPOSITS. Epithelial cancer, internally and locally (W. Owens). Sycosis with nodules and formations in the joints. Hard chancre. The 1X solution will soften and cause formation of pus.
dosage: Third to thirtieth potency. Not to be repeated too often, except in croup.
